MARITAL STATUS

Profession Actor

Birth name Timothy Leonard Dalton Leggett

British nationality

Birth March 21, 1946 (Colwyn Bay, Wales – Great Britain)

BIOGRAPHY

It was while playing the play MacBeth at the age of sixteen that Timothy Dalton discovered his vocation as an actor. From then on, he studied acting at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art and later joined the Birmingham Repertory Theater . In 1966, he made his first television appearance in the series Sat’day while Sunday , where he rubbed shoulders with the young Malcolm McDowell , and two years later he found himself opposite Peter O’Toole in the medieval Lion in Winter ( 1968).

Deemed too young to play James Bond in On Her Majesty’s Secret Service (id.), he continued in the costume film by playing Prince Rupert in Cromwell (1970) by Ken Hughes and Lord Henry Darnley in Mary Stuart (1971) by Charles Jarrott . While working on the theater work of William Shakespeare , Timothy Dalton embarked on an international career, appearing in El Hombre que supo amar (1978), a Spanish historical drama set during the time of the Inquisition, and in the American blockbuster Flash Gordon (1980).

Reuniting with Vanessa Redgrave , his partner in Marie Stuart , for the drama Agatha (1979), he was very active on television in the 1980s, following the series Jane Eyre (1983) and L’Amour en inheritance (1983 ). 1984). In 1987, he took his revenge on the famous agent 007, twice donning his tuxedo in Killing Is Not Playing (1987) and License to Kill (1989), both directed by John Glen .

Despite the popularity acquired thanks to this role, the actor did not manage to rise to the rank of star and was content to play in highly successful films: The King’s Whore (1990), the adaptation of the novel by Jacques Tournier by Alex Corti , The Rocketeer (1991), where he plays a pro-Nazi actor, or even Naked in New York (1993) by Daniel Algrant . After playing Rhett Butler in the television series Scarlett (1994) and Emperor Julius Caesar in the television film Cleopatra (1999), Timothy Dalton returned to the cinema by taking on the features of a local sheriff battling gangsters in the polar False deal (id.).

Four years later, he self-parodied as a secret agent, father of Brendan Fraser , in Looney Tunes Come Action (2003), an adventure comedy by Joe Dante mixing real actors and cartoon characters. In 2010, he completely adopted the genre by lending his voice to Mr. Labrosse in the last part of the adventures of Toy Story 3 .
